definition: can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: They showed me into a bleak waiting room.
sentences.chinese: 他们引我来到一间阴冷的会客室。

sentences.english: The vouchers can be used in the restaurant or the lounge.
sentences.chinese: 抵用券可在餐厅及会客厅使用。

sentences.english: Many house restaurants and fancy guesthouses.
sentences.chinese: 许多驻京办都配备宾馆和豪华的会客室。

sentences.english: About four metres long, the room served as a small reception hall for important visitors .
sentences.chinese: 琥珀屋长约4米，被用作接待重要来宾的小型会客室。

sentences.english: It takes one into the heart of the Victorian parlour.
sentences.chinese: 茶把我们带到了维多利亚时期会客厅的关键。

sentences.english: Meeting room that free your imagination by opening to grand panoramas.
sentences.chinese: 面对城市全景的会客厅任你的想象驰聘。

sentences.english: This sitting room will be bursting at the seams when all the guests arrive.
sentences.chinese: 当所有客人到来时，这间会客室将会拥挤不堪。

sentences.english: On the ?rst ?oor, there is usually a kitchen and a reception room.
sentences.chinese: 在一楼，一般是厨房和会客厅。

sentences.english: Meeting in progress, please do not disturb.
sentences.chinese: 会客中，请勿打扰是什么意思啊？

sentences.english: He ushered me into the reception room.
A coffee bar named Qiyuan is an ideal place for meeting friends.
sentences.chinese: 名曰“憩园”的咖啡厅是您交友会客的极好去处。

sentences.english: The next ring has 36 meeting rooms.
sentences.chinese: 再往外一圈有36个会客室。

sentences.english: He will only see visitors by appointment.
Obey the regulations and rules on visitors. Meeting visitors in your accommodation is allowed in the permitted time, but staying overnight is not allowed.
sentences.chinese: 遵守会客制度，在规定的时间内会客，不能留客过夜。

sentences.english: Obey the regulations and rules on visitors. Meeting visitors in your accommodation is allowed in the permitted time, but staying overnight is not allowed.
sentences.chinese: 遵守会客制度，在规定的时间内会客，不能留客过夜。

sentences.english: Like the nuns, the pupils saw their relatives only in the parlor.
sentences.chinese: 寄读生和修女一样，只能在会客室里接见她们的亲人。

definition: drawing room (room for arriving guests)/living room/CL:間|间[jian1]
to receive sb/to grant an interview
to handle official business/to work (esp. in an office)
